sub_title: Senior Advocacy Advisor at PharmAccess Foundation
summary:
I  work as a Senior Advocacy Advisor at PharmAccess, an international non-profit organization dedicated to strengthening health markets in sub-Saharan Africa through public-private partnerships and digital technology. I have a strong track record in personal and community (global) health, with experience in health promotion, advocacy, communications and research, as well as in care provision, coaching, customer support and data reviewing.
I am passionate about health innovations, children's health, sport for development, non-communicable diseases (NCDs), nutrition, food security, environmental issues and I am driven to working towards finding sustainable ways to reduce global health inequalities and making the world a healthier place.
I have lived, studied or worked in four continents (Africa, North America, Asia and Europe.)

profile_positions.description:
I work closely with the Advocacy Director for wider implementation of strategies, policies and proven best practices,  towards health system transformation. Specifically, this entails:
•	In collaboration with country offices, business leads and relevant stakeholders, provide analysis and produce accessible papers, reports and policy briefings on health financing and delivery, digitalization, public-private partnerships and PharmAccess’ priority themes and initiatives.
•	Develop, evaluate, and periodically update national health accounts (NHA) and other data sets from sources such as the World Bank IFC, OECD, research institutions and local think-tanks on key socio-economic, health and technology indices to inform our work in priority countries.
•	Facilitate the convening of international expert meetings and conferences and the participation of leading thought leaders, policy makers and private sector entities to influence policies and institutions for innovations, financing, delivery, and private sector development in health.
•	Provide advice on the work of Advocacy officers and coordinate the collaboration of Communications, Research, Advocacy and Resource Mobilization Units to ensure synergy for better visibility and impact of PharmAccess’ work.
•	Support in establishing and maintaining strategic partnerships and coalitions
profile_positions.title: Senior Advocacy Advisor

profile_positions.description:
PharmAccess works to improve healthcare quality and access in Africa, by taking an integrated approach, leveraging innovative partnerships and by harnessing the power of mobile/digital technology. PharmAccess mobilizes public and private resources for the benefit of healthcare providers and patients through health insurance, loans to doctors, clinical standards and quality improvements, private investments and operational research.
My role includes working to help improve advocacy, policy and development outcomes of PharmAccess. Specifically this means:
•	Providing analysis on health financing and delivery, mHealth, private sector development and public-private partnerships (PPPs). 
•	Producing reports, briefings and advocacy materials on PharmAccess' priority themes and initiatives.
•	Developing, evaluating and updating national health accounts (NHA) for priority countries, including 
 Ghana, Kenya, Tanzania and Nigeria. 
•	Developing and Analyzing data sets from sources such as the World Bank/IFC, OECD, research institutions and national governments on key socio-economic, health, technology and development indices to inform our work. 
•	Coordinating PharmAccess' participation in conferences and the dissemination of strategic information to stimulate thought leadership.
•	Establishing and maintaining strategic partnerships and coalitions for digital health financing and delivery.
•	Supporting country offices in the positioning of advocacy agenda and domestic resource mobilization (local/national governments financing for sustainability).
profile_positions.title: Advocacy Officer

profile_positions.description:
The United Nations (UN) Global Compact is a call to companies and organizations to align their strategies and operations with ten universal principles related to human rights, labor, environment and anti-corruption, and take actions that advance the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

The Young Professionals Program is a 12 month leadership program, hosted by the UN Global Compact Network Netherlands. As a member, I work in a multidisciplinary team of eleven young professionals from diverse backgrounds and sectors to help drive impact around the SDGs.
profile_positions.title: Young Professionals Program (UN Global Compact)

profile_positions.description:
Roamler is an innovator and leader in the market research industry, using crowd-sourcing and mobile technology to "change the way people work". Roamler manages a crowd of thousands of individuals or "Roamlers" who collect insights, execute retail audits and perform merchandising activities across Europe. 
My role as a member of the International Review Team required great attention to detail, flexibility and excellent interpersonal communication skills. By reviewing market research data, I ensured that the data we provided to our clients was accurate and of the highest quality. I also ensured the continued success and satisfaction of our crowd by providing technical support and advice to Roamlers through our digital messaging platform. 
As an experienced Reviewer, I helped with editing and writing content, giving staff trainings and working closely with project managers to help co-ordinate the review team and meet the expectations of our clients.
profile_positions.title: Support Reviewer

profile_positions.description:
The Centre for Equity studies is a Delhi-based NGO that does a range of research and advocacy work for marginalized groups in India. One key component of their work is Street Medicine; a homeless outreach program that provides medical care and support to those living under bridges, next to railway tracks, on river banks, abandoned buildings, pavements or footpaths.
During my internship, I conducted a two-fold research project as part of my Master's thesis. The aim was first, to understand the challenges faced by the Street Medicine team and second,  to understand how an mHealth (Mobile Health) tool could be designed to address some of these challenges.

I was responsible for managing all aspects of the research project throughout the planning, design and implementation phases. My research took a transdisciplinary (TDR) approach, in which I engaged key stakeholders in all phases of the research. Data collection methods included: conducting field observations, semi-structured interviews and a literature review of both academic and non-academic sources. In addition to my thesis, I wrote a 22-page report outlining recommendations for the design of the mHealth tool (App).
In addition to my research commitments, I also participated in weekly staff meetings and assisted the Street Medicine team with treating and referring patients. Lastly, I developed a nutrition survey for the team to use to help identify nutritional deficiencies among homeless children in Delhi.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description:
The Academic Medical Center (AMC) is a world-renowned academic medical hospital which provides integrated patient care, fundamental and clinical scientific research, and teaching.
My internship was in the AMC's department of Medical Ethics, where I worked to investigate peoples’ relationship with medical technology.
I conducted a mixed-methods research project in the field of mHealth (Mobile Health) with a focus on 'every-day trackers,' the regular users of health applications, FitBits and other wearable tracking technologies. The aim of the project was to understand what the practice of 'self-tracking' looks like and the values that 'every-day trackers' hold in these practices. 
I managed the entire research project throughout the design, implementation and analysis phases. I conducted a literature review, developed interview and survey guides, and conducted in-depth semi-structured interviews. I analyzed the interviews using MAXQDA software and analyzed the quantitative survey data using SPSS. In addition to my research responsibilities, I also participated in the departments monthly 'Philosophy of Care' meetings in which I joined medical specialists and researchers to discuss research and other current issues in the field of medical ethics.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description:
Healthdare is a health technology start-up which promotes the adoption of healthy habits which last a life time. Using the spirit of competition, Healthdare provides a platform for users to compete with friends, family and colleagues in a 40 day 'dare' to get healthy, inspire others and give back.
In my role as a content developer I had the responsibility of gathering the latest nutritional and exercise science research and writing daily content for Healthdare's blog page. I also managed the company's social media platforms and provided customer support. As the company's first employee, I was also actively involved in the company's strategic decisions and represented Healthdare as an ambassador during community outreach events.
profile_positions.title: Content Developer

profile_positions.description:
RedLine Athletics is a sports-specific training facility, where highly accomplished athletes, former professionals and specially certified trainers train young athletes to improve strength, speed, agility and sport-specific skills. 
In my role as a Sports Performance Specialist, I worked with young athletes between the ages of eight and eighteen to help them excel in their given sport. I conducted athletic performance tests and assessed athletes' risk of injury. I guided athletes through one on one and group work-out sessions designed to improve strength, agility and speed. The position allowed me to gain valuable customer service and sales skills as I was required to help promote and sell membership packages, and to build strong relationships with our customers (young athletes and parents). 
In addition to the above responsibilities, I developed my own Soccer Skills program in which I provided specialized soccer-specific coaching. I was in charge of promoting, managing and running the Soccer Skills program. I served as a role model for young athletes, positively contributing to their athletic and personal development, for example by providing psychological support and motivation when they were injured or falling behind on their school work.
profile_positions.title: Sports Performance Specialist

profile_positions.description:
During my role as a Home Healthcare Aide, I provided a range of nursing and healthcare services to my patient, a T-7 paraplegic. 
I started the job as a nursing assistant, only providing minor medical care. However, after receiving hands-on practical training from certified nurses and after gaining the trust of my patient, I was given full responsibility of healthcare provision and management. Besides general healthcare and personal hygiene, I provided wound care and provided bi-monthly catheter changes.  
This role required a high level of responsibility as I coordinated my patient's medical appointments, consulted medical staff, monitored wounds and other health conditions, as well as being on call in the case of emergencies. 
Over three years, I gained a range of practical and theoretical medical knowledge, and perhaps most importantly in care work, learnt how to work with compassion, empathy and trust.
profile_positions.title: Home Healthcare Aide
